alert.note: Alert for Cheshire; Hillsborough; Merrimack; Sullivan (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 17 at 5:51PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and southern New Hampshire, including the following counties, in central New Hampshire, Merrimack and Sullivan. In southern New Hampshire, Cheshire and Hillsborough. * WHEN...Until 900 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 548 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to showers with embedded thunder. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall is expected through this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Franklin, Jaffrey, Henniker, New London, Milford, Peterborough, Rindge, Hopkinton, New Boston and Antrim.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
